page.title: 08 History of Silverton
page.content:
Pigs park, we think, is where people in Silverton first lived. We believe this because part of an encampment was found in this area that dates back to the Iron Age (300 B.C).
By Saxon times Silverton, pronounced Silvertone, was a very important village as it was the hundred that included many of the surrounding villages.
Silverton, we believe, is the only village in Devon to have some 14th century {Hallhouses.}(See Hallhouses); there are also a number of later, traditional, cob and thatch cottages.
Silverton owes its size to the fact that it was once on the coaching route from Exeter to Tiverton.
